definition: classifier for an activity, taken in its entirety (tirade of abuse, stint of music playing, bout of drinking etc)
to go through/to know well/(suffix) expert/to connect/to communicate/open/to clear/classifier for letters, telegrams, phone calls etc

sentences.english: Interest rates and inflation are both due to climb.
sentences.chinese: 利率和通脹率都必定上升。

sentences.english: The US is targeting a 5 per cent-plus inflation rate for the foreseeable future.
sentences.chinese: 美國計劃在可預見的未來達到5%以上的通脹率。

sentences.english: What puts a spanner into this adjustment mechanism is the rise in global inflation.
sentences.chinese: 進一步攪亂這種調整機制的是全球通脹率的上升。

sentences.english: The US is targeting a 5 percent-plus inflation rate for the foreseeable future.
sentences.chinese: 在可預見的未來，美國的通脹率目標是5%甚至更高。

sentences.english: Inflation over that period was shockingly low.
sentences.chinese: 這段時期中國的通脹率維持在非常低的水平。

sentences.english: An energy-driven headline inflation rate of 3% hardly spells disaster.
sentences.chinese: 能源驅使的總體通脹率達到3%並不會帶來危險。

sentences.english: Prices -- uncorrected for inflation -- are now at record highs.
sentences.chinese: 未經通脹率修正的黃金價格目前已創歷史新高。

sentences.english: In 1994 the inflation rate in Armenia hit 27, 000%.
sentences.chinese: 1994年間亞美尼亞的通脹率達到27000%。

pinyin: guo2 nei4 sheng1 chan3 zong3 zhi2

definition: to slow/to slow down (the pace of)
to adjust downwards/to lower (prices, wages etc)
to demote/to pass down to a lower unit
